intro: Hieraciodes triasii, commonly known as the Triassic Hieracium, is a rare flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its small, daisy-like yellow flowers and hairy, lance-shaped leaves. Native to specific regions in Europe, this plant thrives in dry, calcareous soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered endangered. Its botanical features make it an important subject for ecological and conservation studies.
